title: Brave bride could own wedding dress worn in Coronation Street's shortest ever marriage
text:

A bride-to-be is being given the chance to bid for the wedding dress worn in TV’s shortest ever marriage. 
Coronation Street fans watched last May as stunning Carla Connor - played by actress Alison King , 44 - donned the dress only to be dumped minutes after exchanging vows. 
Furious groom Nick Tilsley - played by Ben Price- stormed off from church to seek an annulment after Carla suddenly confessed at the altar to having a steamy affair. 
The doomed nuptials was one of Alison’s last scenes after 10 years playing Carla before she left the show to pursue other acting projects. 
Now ITV1 bosses have gifted her wedding dress to St Johns Hospice, in Kendal, Cumbria, to help raise some vital funds for the good cause. Read More Coronation Street spoiler: Michelle seeks vengeance by making a move on Nick The wedding dress worn for soap land's shortest ever marriage is going on eBay in aid of a palliative care charity 
The dress will be auctioned on eBay over 10 days to hopeful brides-to-be, starting from Saturday 18th March. 
It will also be on display in the hospice’s Kendal shop if any brides want to try it on for size. 
Heather Taylor, St John’s Hospice retail general manager, said: “We are so grateful to Coronation Street for donating this dress to us. 
“There is always a huge demand for this kind of memorabilia so we are hopeful it can raise a good sum for St John’s Hospice. 
“A bride always wants her special day to be unique. Read More Heartbroken bride-to-be selling dream wedding dress after split from fiancé following devastating diagnosis Roy Cropper walks Carla down the aisle (Photo: ITV) 
“What better way than to walk down the aisle in a dress featured in one of the most successful British TV shows of all time?” 
Alison was cast as Carla in 2006 but made her first appearance in 2004 as another character called Mrs Fanshaw in a one-off storyline with Jason Grimshaw (Ryan Thomas). 
Last May viewers were shocked when Carla halted her wedding after having an affair. 
Nick told her how beautiful she looked and the congregation sat as the minister began the proceedings. 
He told the crowd: “A marriage is not an easy path, it requires honesty, the wisdom to know when we’re wrong, and the strength to put things right.” Read More Best budget bridesmaid dresses from the high street and online for 2017 - from Phase Eight, Hobbs and more Carla getting ready on the famous Cobbles 
Prompted by these words, after exchanging vows and being declared man and wife, Carla turned to her fiancee and said: “Nick, I need to speak to you in private. I need to tell you something.” 
To make things even more nerve racking, her secret lover - bistro chef Robert Preston (actor Tristan Gemmill) - was sitting in the congregation watching it all unfold. Unsurprisingly, Nick stormed out for an immediate annulment. 
The dress comes with a certificate of authenticity and a signed photograph of Alison King, who left the soap after her character's dramatic wedding day in 2016. St John’s Hospice, founded in 1986, are specialists in palliative care for a range of life shortening conditions. For more information, and to access to the link to bid on the dress, visit www.sjhospice.org.uk/coronationstreet . Like us on Facebook
